content.description: Start on good holds on the left side of the boulder, move into a juggy undercling, then commit to the slab above. This line climbs directly up the tallest part of the boulder.
content.location: Located on the Deathlands boulder, large detached boulder just downhill from Dawn Mist.

content.description: Sit start on crimps on the lip of small roof. Dead point between prominent finger slots.
content.location: First route encountered Right of Dawn Mist sector

content.description: Sit start to triple stoop. Start matched on a sloping diving board like feature. Climb up slopers, then traverse slightly right into triple stoop.
content.location: Located on the far left side of the deathlands boulder.

content.description: Starts to the right of the crack just past the detached boulder. Start on lower ledge beneath roof, work out of roof to the right to ledge in the middle of the face, then heel down on the lip, move out to crimp, then power finish to lip.
Begin with RH on small crimp under roof, LH on slopper at the lip. Bust tough moves on crimps, surf right through radical coral crimps and heel hook bodacious barnacles.
content.location: Located on beautiful band of limestone, just right of giant detached boulder.

content.description: Same start at The Reef, bust tough moves, then shoot up to good incuts and top out.

I honestly have no idea how hard this is. This project starts from a sit deep in the cave on an obvious undercling. A very cool intro section (probably hard V7 in itself) leads to an inconceivable move to a fat sloper. What appears to be more core-intensive hard climbing should topout through a small dihedral feature (Garbage in Space V8). A very, very hard problem, with bad feet throughout. Not a bit of bad rock on it, but one of the jugs is very sharp. Consider tape, and possibly a kneepad.
content.location: In in the cave climber's left of the walk down, look for an obvious compression feature, and start at the obvious undercling from a sit. Only seems to be one way out, and it's the only sit start in the cave itself.

content.description: Hard to figure out exactly how it would work, but there is definitely a problem that heads out the cave right of the other project. Locate a couple large jugs and figure it out from there. There seems to be a hard horizontal compression problem but the feet situation is dire. This one might be very very hard.
content.location: In the cave containing the other listed project, search the right hand side for some holds that don't seem to go together. Finishes somewhere near the Frank Finds Boulders extension's finish.

content.description: Fun movement on solid rock, but unfortunately the problem seems to be perpetually extremely dirty and slick. Squat start on a sloper or sit start slightly lower on a pair of slopey crimps for an extra move. Traverse left through weird, inobvious moves with a surprising amount of footwork, and head straight up left of the tree with a few powerful moves on jugs, grabbing the top of what appears from below to be a loose block (it isn't, hopefully...) and topping out.
content.location: From the main trail, turn left down the cliff line. Continue south past two roof systems. NSEWU starts on the far right side of a detached boulder.

content.description: Located at the far north end of the cliff. Scramble past the giant detached boulder... Sit start under the roof on good holds, toss right hand to sloped edge, power your way to a good pocket and top out on sculpted jugs.
Start a perfect incut crimp above head height. Deadpoints and a long reach gets you jugs and the lip.
content.location: Located at the far south end of the cliff.

content.description: A lower start to Loaded Diaper. Core-tensiony moves on small holds lead to a big move to the perfect incut start crimp on the original problem. Highly recommended.
content.location: This is the last obvious start under the roof on the south end of the cliff. Look for an extremely small left undercling and a nice right hand pocket. This is just as the choss band/skirt peters out. Another problem on extremely small holds goes right from the start, or could provide another start to Loaded Diaper that's even harder.

content.description: Climb Frank Finds Boulders to the obvious jug on the lip of the roof. Instead of topping out, head left through a small, sharp intermediate and a slopey rail. Campus or throw a high foot, dunk a perfect jug, and top out left of the tree. 4 star movement, 2 star line.
content.location: Start as for FFB, ends left of the tree.

content.description: Start on a right hand crimp and left hand sloper on the far right side of the roof. Climb left through slopers and crimps to an obvious jug and top out. Excellent movement, and quite stout for the grade.
content.location: FFB is jut right of the main walkdown, on the far right side of the large cave.

content.description: Starts on right side of Deathlands Boulder. Start on slopers, Pull into a juggy underling, mount the slab, climb the ridge like lip of the boulder and top out for Triple Stoop or throw a leg over and top out direct.
Climb onto the choss band and do a move to reach a good four finger pocket. Proceed up the bulge.
content.location: This line tops out the tallest part of the cliff at the dump. Located between Event Horizon and Loaded Diaper.

content.description: Start on low jugs. Traverse the ridge to the summit. Kind of mossy...
content.location: Deathlands boulder, climb the ridge on the far right of the boulder

content.description: Excellent, powerful climbing on good edges. The line faintly traces the arete but not everyone uses holds on the right side of the arete. Tall people can cheat way out left onto slabby rock. for a much easier and lower-quality finish.
content.protection: 2 pads are adequate without a spotter.
content.location: Dawn mist is the obvious, usually chalky arete left of the walkdown. I've heard a number of beta for the start, but to me, the most obvious start is with the left hand on the lowest edge above the roof and the right hand on a pinch around the corner. I have also seen it started with the right hand on a smeary slopey crimp on the left face. Both felt similar in difficulty, with the pinch start possibly being a touch harder.

content.description:
DUMP

  n 

  1. Site for depositing garbage.    "Hey Jim, lets go violate mother nature and throw trash off this cliff and into the Blue River, I've used it as a dump for years" 

  2. Mother Nature's deposit of radical limestone bouldering in Kansas City.    "Yo Bro, are you down for another gnarly bouldering session at The Dump"
